briefTitle: Perioperative Antibiotic Therapy to Prevent Cardiac Implantable Electronic Device Infections.

armGroups.label: Antibiotic irrigation and PO antibiotics
interventionNames: Drug: cephalexin, or levofloxacin, or clindamycin

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Age ≥18 years old
* Able to give informed consent
* At least 2 of the following risk factors for infection:

  * Diabetes mellitus
  * Chronic kidney disease (estimated creatinine clearance \<30 ml/min
  * Therapeutic anticoagulation
  * Chronic heart failure
  * Chronic use of corticosteroids
  * Fever ≥38° C or leukocytois (≥11,000 cells/mm3) within 24 hrs of implant
  * Device revision (including generator change, or extraction)
  * ≥3 leads in situ (CRT system or abandoned leads)
  * Early reoperation (pocket re-entry \<2 weeks)
  * Previous CIED infection

Exclusion Criteria:

* Medical condition that is likely to be fatal in less than one year
* Emergent CIED procedure
* Allergy to rifampin or minocycline, Allergy to polymyxin-B or bacitracin
* Enrollment in WRAP-IT trial
* Current CIED pocket infection

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Patients With a Major Cardiac Implantable Electronic Devices (CIED) Infection
outcomeMeasures.description: The primary study endpoint will be the number of patients with CIED infection resulting in complete CIED system removal, antibiotic therapy in patients who are not candidates for system removal, or death due to CIED infection.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Patients With a Minor Cardiac Implantable Electronic Devices (CIED) Infection
outcomeMeasures.description: A minor superficial infection of the incision that does not involve the generator pocket, does not result in any systemic symptoms or signs, and is treated with either observation or a short course of oral antibiotics
